stem: A patient complains of seasonal watery nasal discharge, sneezing, and nasal block. What would you prescribe him?
disc: Allergic rhinitis is a persistent disease in most patients which requires long-term maintenance therapy. One of the most effective maintenance treatments is topical steroids which are particularly effective at releasing nasal congestion (e.g. beclomethasone, flunisolide, budesonide, fluticasone propionate, mometasone furoate, fluticasone furoate, and ciclesonide). They have fever side effects at the recommended dosage. It can be effectively used in both mild/moderate and severe forms of allergic rhinitis.
